channel.title: Renaming Teleports Need ID [PI]
channel.description: So I want to rename Varrock Teloport to Monster teleport ect... The problem is that I switched clients and the client I am using has different teleport Id's so I can't rename the teleport. The client I am using is the project maramos client and I started from a cleaned PI base. If anybody knows the teleport ids for that client or could tell me how to find I would appreciate it!

item.title: Renaming Teleports Need ID [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So is the id 1164 the correct id or?
And like I said, if the ID’s I gave you don’t work, you’re probably loading a custom interface.

Run something like:

for(int i = 0;i < 10000;i++){
     c.getPA().sendFrame126(""+i, i);
}

That will loop through 10,000 id’s and print their number for you. Maybe then you’ll find the ID you’re looking for.

Read full topic

item.title: Renaming Teleports Need ID [PI]
item.dc:creator: @defer48 defer48
item.description:
@defer48 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:538922”]Unless you have a custom spellbook the teleport ID’s shouldn’t change.

Parent: 1151 Id: 1300 "Level 25 : Varrock Teleport" Parent: 1151 Id: 1301 "Teleports you to Varrock"
Parent = The interface it is on
Id = the actual string id, this is what you’d use in sendFrame126 to change it.[/quote]
Have a look at the code all the Id’s are regular.

So does the client have custom ID’s? I figured that if I looked at the source that goes with the client I would find the correct Id’s but instead I find this…

public void handleLoginText() { //c.getPA().sendFrame126("Monster Teleport", 1164); }

Read full topic

item.title: Renaming Teleports Need ID [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Unless you have a custom spellbook the teleport ID’s shouldn’t change.

Parent: 1151 Id: 1300 "Level 25 : Varrock Teleport" Parent: 1151 Id: 1301 "Teleports you to Varrock"
Parent = The interface it is on
Id = the actual string id, this is what you’d use in sendFrame126 to change it.

Read full topic
